variant.question: Some of the certification requirements for large aeroplanes described in CS-25 are the performance data defined as gradients of the flight path and the net flight path. What is the difference between those two factors?

options.text: The net flight path gradient is the flight path gradient reduced by prescribed safety margins, which depend on the number of engines.
The net flight path gradient is first established based on obstacle clearance, and this is reduced by a safety margin to establish the flight path gradient.
The flight path gradient includes safety factors and is based on the net flight path gradient, which is determined by flight testing.
The flight path gradient is the actual path flown by the aeroplane, which is increased by safety factors to introduce a safety margin for the net flight path.
